snippet: “Orange, Red, Yellow,” a 1961 canvas by Mark Rothko, sold for nearly $87 million, and prices for artists like Pollock also brought record amounts.
abstract: Mark Rothko painting brings in nearly $87 million at Christie's, shattering all auction records for contemporary art. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: A dreamy canvas of three colors -- Mark Rothko's ''Orange, Red, Yellow,'' from 1961 -- shattered all auction records for contemporary art at Christie's on Tuesday evening, selling for nearly $87 million. It was a stunning moment in an auction that itself brought in the highest total ever in the postwar and contemporary category. In an overflowing salesroom, collectors and dealers from all over the world watched intently as prices for artists like Jackson Pollock, Barnett Newman, Alexander Calder, Gerhard Richter and Yves Klein brought more than they ever had before.

headline.main: Rothko Painting ($87 Million) and Other Art Bring Record Sales at Christie's
